sen.j: 文室氏（ふんやし）は、天武天皇の皇子長親王の後裔氏族。
sen.e: The Funya clan was the descendant clan of Naga no Miko (Imperial Prince Naga) who was a prince of the Emperor Tenmu.
The Funya clan was a descendent clan of Naga no Miko (Imperial Prince Naga), a son of the Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 752年（天平勝宝4年）智努王・大市王が文室の姓を賜っている。
sen.e: In 752, the Imperial Court gave the surname "Funya" to Chinu-O (King Chinu) and Oochi-O (King Oochi).
In 752, Chinu-O (King Chinu) and Ochi-O (King Ochi) were given the surname "Funya" by the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 文の意味上の主語は、「朝廷」ではなく「帝」ではないかと思うのですが、断定しかねます。
sen.e: In 752, Chinu-O (King Chinu) and Ochi-O (King Ochi) were given the surname "Funya" by the Emperor.

sen.j: この他に772年（宝亀3年）長谷於保が改めて文室姓を賜っており、文室（文屋）氏には長親王以外の複数の系統がある。
sen.e: Additionally, in 772, the Imperial Court again gave "Funya" the surname of Oyasu (or Oo) HASE.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, in 772, the surname "Funya" was again given to Oyasu (or Oo) HASE; such being the case, there existed several lines of the Funya clan (written as "文室氏" or "文屋氏") which were not descended from Naga no Miko.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直しました。「長谷於保」の読みが不明です。また、原文通り本文と次の文をまとめて一文としました。
sen.e: Additionally, in 772, the surname "Funya" was again given to Oyasu (or Oo) HASE; such being the case, there existed several lines of the Funya clan (written as "文室氏" or "文屋氏") which were not descended from Naga no Miko.

sen.j: 坂上田村麻呂以前の蝦夷などの征討事業にかかわった文室大原、胆沢城・志波城に拠って東北地域の経営に携わり中納言に至った文室綿麻呂、承和の変に連座した参議文室秋津、そして、六歌仙の一人文屋康秀などがいる。
sen.e: FUNYA no Ohara was of the lineage family of the Funya clan and involved with the conquest of Emishi (a group of people who lived in the northeastern region of Japan; this location is currently known as the Tohoku region.) before SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro would involve to do so.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Of the lineage of the Funya clan were FUNYA no Ohara who was involved with the conquest of Emishi (a group of people who lived in the northeastern region of Japan) before SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, FUNYA no Watamaro who was engaged in the administration of the Tohoku region (the northeast region of Japan) from his base in Isawa-jo and Shiwa-jo Castles and later appointed Chunagon (Middle Councilor), Sangi (Councilor) FUNYA no Akitsu who was involved with the Jowa Incident, and FUNYA no Yasuhide, one of Rokkasen (the six selected great poets of the Waka [Japanese poem] in the Heian period).
sen.cmt: 表現を簡潔にし、原文通り本文と以下３文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: Of the lineage of the Funya clan were FUNYA no Ohara who was involved with the conquest of Emishi (a group of people who lived in the northeastern region of Japan) before SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, FUNYA no Watamaro who was engaged in the administration of the Tohoku region (the northeast region of Japan) from his base in Isawa-jo and Shiwa-jo Castles and later appointed Chunagon (Middle Councilor), Sangi (Councilor) FUNYA no Akitsu who was involved with the Jowa Incident, and FUNYA no Yasuhide, one of Rokkasen (the six selected great poets of the Waka [Japanese poem] in the Heian period).
